intro: Daucus siculus, commonly known as the Sicilian carrot, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like parsley and celery. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately lobed, and the roots are typically thin and less developed compared to cultivated carrots. Daucus siculus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and arid environments.
